abstract: Connecticut Gov Dannel P Malloy finds that, due to accounting error, his proposed two-year spending plan exceeds legally allowed limit by $60 million; Benjamin Barns of state's Office of Policy and Management apologizes for error and promises to bring budget into line.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Dannel P. Malloy had already presented a budget to the state legislature before the accounting error was discovered by the Office of Fiscal Analysis.

headline.main: $60 Million Error Is Found in Connecticut Governor’s Budget Proposal
headline.print_headline: $60 Million Error Is Found in Malloy’s Budget Proposal

snippet: Gov. Dannel P. Malloy had already presented a budget to the state legislature before the accounting error was discovered by the Office of Fiscal Analysis.
